messages.message:
:wave: Hi all! I'm working on *splitting the UAT and dogfood* *databases.* I'm planning to do the split *next Tuesday* if things go according to plan. This will give plenty of time for working out kinks before the next UAT cycle starts in mid-Oct.

The goal of the split is to completely isolate the UAT and dogfood databases, and thereby reduce conflicts/corrupted state during UAT.

More details:
• I'm planning to clone dogfood's *database* and *S3 buckets*, so that UAT and dogfood will start off mostly identical. 
• After the split, changes made in UAT will not be visible in dogfood and vice-versa.  For example, users added after the split to dogfood *will not* show up in UAT.
• UAT will use PostgreSQL, whereas dogfood uses Oracle (for reference, production uses MySQL). This will give us coverage of another database backend.
Please let me know if you have comments/questions/concerns!
